rule.name: Survived Mutants
rule.description:
Survived mutant

A mutant of a class has not been killed although appearing to be covered by a test.

If you don't want to active any mutator specific rule, you may use this rule which is triggered by any Mutator. You should not active this rule, when you use mutator specific rules, as it may result in redundant issued.

For more information check out the PIT documentation

rule.name: Uncovered Mutants
rule.description:
Uncovered mutant

A mutant of a class has not been covered by a test at all.

An uncovered mutant is also a survived mutant. If you activate this rule, it will produce more issues than the Survived Mutant rule. It's advised to have either this or the Survived Mutant rule activated, but not both, as it will result in duplicate issues.Further it is not recommended to have this rule activated with any of the mutator specific rules.

For more information check out the PIT documentation

rule.name: Mutation Coverage below threshold
rule.description: The coverage of mutations killed by tests is below the configured threshold.

param.description: Mutation coverage is calculated by the ratio of killed mutants and total number of mutants. If the ratio (in percent) is below this threshold value, an issue for the resource is.

rule.name: Mutant with unknown Status
rule.description: The Status of a mutant is unknown.
